condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: 5.4 MEST, Local Councils, schools and communities have the capacity to plan, implement and monitor equitable delivery of education services by end December 2019.

description.narrative: The Ministry of Basic and Senior Secondary Education (MBSSE) prioritised efficient and effective data collection and better utilisation to improve its planning, decision making and policy formulation capacities. This was evidenced by improved access and availability of quality school data through integrated systems including the establishment of a dashboard and alignment of the Situation Room to Education Management and Information System using the EduTrac platform resulting in better decision making for the equitable delivery of education services. | Status:Met | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: (NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of policy discourse on environmental sustainability (including climate change) that incorporate children's rights
(NOT VALID after Dec 31 2017) Existence of Planning and monitoring systems that explicitly address risks at national and subnational level
Percentage (and number) of countries with effective education systems for learning outcomes, including early learning

System Strengthening - EMIS - Availability of an Education Management Information System that transparently feeds findings back to communities or school management committees - score (1-4), see guidance
